ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about theoretical frameworks in American education
I learned a lot about how to critically evaluate media as well as look into the roots of certain issues that are commonly seen in education, particularly those related to race.
Learned theoretical frameworks of how issues of race are at play in the us school system
I learned how to analyze and apply theories of race, place, and memory studies to understand different schooling systems and reforms.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the way the course is currently developed was very good for my needs, the strengths were that the professor was very flexible with needs and I never felt like I was scrambling to get work done at risk of my grades tanking.

In Week 6, the reading was a bit too heavy and could be adjusted. other than that, I appreciated how Errol made adjustments every week depending on student feedback - he was super attentive to our experiences and engaging with the class was very manageable and fun.
The class covered everything well, but I would have loved a tiny bit of lecture at the beginning since everyone seemed to come in with different conceptions of the reading
I liked the structure of the course and how we built on previous understandings in a specific methodical way.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course if you can take it! Not only is it great material but Mr. Saunders is a great teacher and the environment of the class was just a great place to be generally. You'll come out of it with new knowledge and a good seminar experience as well.
Definitely! If you are interested in the theory of race and its simultaneous implementation, it definitely fits that bill.
Yes especially if you are interested in theories of education!

extras.title: AFAM 261 01/AMST 263 01/EDST 263 01 - Place, Race, Memory in Schools
